description: Tox21BodyMap provides a visualization of mapping 971 Tox21 ToxCast assay targets to regions of the human body, and allows users to identify target tissues where a specific chemical is more likely to produce effects.
name: Tox21BodyMap

metadata.abstract: © 2020 Oxford University Press. All rights reserved.To support rapid chemical toxicity assessment and mechanistic hypothesis generation, here we present an intuitive webagent allowing a user to identify target organs in the human body where a substance is estimated to be more likely to produce effects. This agent, called Tox21BodyMap, incorporates results of 9,270 chemicals tested in the United States federal Tox21 research consortium in 971 high-throughput screening (HTS) assays whose targets were mapped onto human organs using organ-specific gene expression data. Via Tox21BodyMap’s interactive agents, users can visualize chemical target specificity by organ system, and implement different filtering criteria by changing gene expression thresholds and activity concentration parameters. Dynamic network representations, data tables, and plots with comprehensive activity summaries across all Tox21 HTS assay targets provide an overall picture of chemical bioactivity. Tox21BodyMap webserver is available at https://sandbox.ntp.niehs.nih.gov/bodymap/.
metadata.title: Tox21BodyMap: A webagent to map chemical effects on the human body
